meanings.definition: The state or condition of being simultaneous.
meanings.sent1: The teacher explained the concept of simultaneity using a simple example.
meanings.sent2: The orchestra's performance was a perfect display of simultaneity.
meanings.sent3: The simultaneity of the twins' actions always amazed their friends.
meanings.sent4: In the chaos of the city, finding moments of true simultaneity felt like discovering hidden gems.
meanings.sent5: The synchronized swimmers moved with such perfect simultaneity that it seemed like a beautiful dance.

meanings.definition: The quality or fact of occurring or existing at the same time.
meanings.sent1: The fireworks display was a stunning example of simultaneity in action.
meanings.sent2: The simultaneity of the thunder and lightning made the storm even more intense.
meanings.sent3: The simultaneity of the two friends arriving at the party in the same outfit caused much laughter.
meanings.sent4: The simultaneity of the sunrise and the birds' morning songs created a magical moment.
meanings.sent5: The traffic lights changing color with perfect simultaneity kept the flow of cars smooth.
